I don't usually like puzzle games, but in Portal they wrap it with perfect world building so I got immersed enough to forget about my usual hatred for puzzle games

Portal really needs no review, but we do it anyway - for science.

Portal sees you play the role of a "person" (although is is never really clearly defined), solving problems and completing tests with a portal gun - all in the name of science. While deceptively simple, and remaining quite easy for the first few levels, it becomes trickier later on, introducing concepts such as conservation of momentum, use of angles, etc.

It is difficult to overstate how good this game is, or how much of an impact it has made. Routinely listed as one of the best games ever made, it remains to this day one of the finest examples of originality in a game. The humour deserves special mention, for being so dark and witty, as well as GlaDOS being expertly voiced - it is as big a part and as notable as the portal action, perhaps more so.

Yahtzee put it better than I ever could, by calling the game "absolutely sublime from start to finish" and being unable to come up with any criticism whatsoever - which has never happened before, and probably never since either. P0rtal/10.

Played on Windows 10 Pro x64 without any issues.

I speedran it and I have the new world record now. In just 3 hours of playing.

The good old days when Valve was making awesome games which are to this day one of my favorites of all time. Portal is no exception. Even if you aren't fan of puzzle games, this might be one of those games which might seriously change your opinion. Also works great even on low-end laptops. I totally recommended this game to anyone. Actually in my opinion everyone should play Portal games at least once of their lifetime.

Good gameplay with a great atmosphere! Completing the game to 100% will cost you some nerves.

10 / 10
Interesting puzzles, but the cake is a lie :(

This game does quite nicely. You wake up confused as a robotic woman walks you through not dying by science. I won't say anymore because of spoilers,but it's simple enough. It's a fun puzzle game and quick to beat (I did it in under 3 hours and I'm stupid). You shoot a gun that makes portals,and this lets you traverse the terrain to effectively do whatever you're trying to do. There isn't much more to the game aside from a dark story that you really should experience for yourself,and the sequel of course,which from what I've done so far,is worth playing too.
